column2: We are seeking a talented and experienced Landscape Architect to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for conceptualizing, designing, and managing landscape projects that enhance the natural beauty of spaces while considering environmental sustainability, functionality, and client needs. Key Responsibilities: Conceptual Design: Develop innovative and aesthetically pleasing landscape concepts that align with client preferences, project goals, and environmental considerations. Site Analysis: Conduct thorough site assessments, analyzing topography, soil conditions, climate, and existing vegetation to inform design decisions. Design Development: Translate conceptual designs into detailed plans, specifying materials, plant selections, and construction details. Ensure designs comply with local regulations and environmental guidelines. Client Interaction: Collaborate closely with clients to understand their vision, goals, and budget constraints. Present design proposals and incorporate client feedback into the final plans. Project Management: Oversee the implementation of landscape projects, coordinating with contractors, suppliers, and other stakeholders. Manage project timelines, budgets, and resources effectively. Sustainable Practices: Integrate sustainable and environmentally friendly practices into landscape designs, including water conservation, native plant selections, and green infrastructure. Team Collaboration: Work collaboratively with architects, engineers, and other professionals to ensure seamless integration of landscape designs with overall project plans. Construction Oversight: Provide on-site supervision during construction to ensure that the design intent is accurately executed.
column11: Landscape Design, Design Development, Sustainable Practices, Construction Oversight, Site Analysis

column2: We are seeking a talented Senior landscape Architect to lead our design team and oversee the execution of projects. As a Senior Architect at Paudha Private Limited, you will be responsible for conceptualizing, designing, and managing the implementation of terrace gardens, balcony gardens, landscape projects. You should have a minimum of 5 years of experience in the industry and possess a deep understanding of materials, designs, and architecture principles. *Responsibilities:* - Lead the design process from conceptualization to execution, ensuring projects are completed on time and within budget. - Develop innovative and sustainable design solutions that align with client requirements and company objectives. - Provide guidance and mentorship to junior architects and design team members. - Collaborate with project managers, engineers, and contractors to ensure seamless project delivery. - Oversee the selection of materials and finishes, ensuring quality and cost-effectiveness. - Conduct site visits and inspections to monitor progress and ensure adherence to design specifications. - Review and approve architectural drawings, plans, and documents. - Keep abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in architecture and design. *Requirements:* - Bachelor's or Master's degree in Architecture from a reputable institution. - Minimum of 5 years of experience in architectural design and project management. - Proficiency in architectural software such as AutoCAD, Revit, and SketchUp. - Strong understanding of construction techniques, materials, and building codes. - Excellent leadership and communication skills. - Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks effectively. - Creative thinking and problem-solving abilities. - Strong attention to detail and a passion for design excellence. *Benefits:* - Competitive salary ranging from 6 to 8 LPA based on experience and qualifications. - Exciting incentives based on project performance and targets achieved. - Opportunity to work in a startup environment with enormous growth potential. - Possibility of ESOPs (Employee Stock Ownership Plans) after the vesting period for long-duration employees. - Comprehensive health insurance and other benefits. - Professional development opportunities and training programs. - Flexible work hours and a supportive work culture. Join us at Paudha Private Limited and be part of a team that is dedicated to creating innovative and sustainable green spaces. If you have a passion for architecture and design and thrive in a dynamic environment, we'd love to hear from you! *How to Apply:* Interested candidates should submit their resume, portfolio, and a cover letter detailing their relevant experience and why they're a great fit for this role to nayanshree@paudha.co or mailtopaudha@gmail.com. Please include "Senior Architect Application" in the subject line. We look forward to reviewing your application!

column2: As a Landscape Architect, you will be responsible for designing and planning outdoor spaces, parks, gardens, and other landscapes to enhance their aesthetic appeal, functionality, and sustainability     You will collaborate with clients, engineers, and other professionals to create environmentally-friendly and visually pleasing landscapes that meet the needs and preferences of the users     Landscape architects work in various sectors, including urban planning, real estate development, public spaces, and private residences     Responsibilities:Site Analysis: Conduct thorough site analysis, including topography, soil conditions, climate, and existing vegetation, to understand the landscape's potential and limitations     Conceptual Design: Develop creative and innovative design concepts for outdoor spaces, considering aesthetics, user experience, and environmental impact     Master Planning: Create comprehensive master plans that outline the layout of landscape elements, such as pathways, green spaces, water features, and structures     Sustainable Design: Integrate sustainable practices into the landscape design, including water conservation, native plant selection, and eco-friendly materials     3D Modeling and Visualization: Use software tools to create 3D models and visualizations that help clients and stakeholders better understand the proposed designs     Construction Documents: Prepare detailed technical drawings and specifications that guide contractors during the construction phase     Project Management: Oversee the implementation of landscape projects, ensuring that designs are executed according to plans and within budget     Client Collaboration: Work closely with clients to understand their needs, preferences, and project goals, incorporating their input into the design process     Environmental Impact Assessment: Assess the potential environmental impacts of landscape projects and propose mitigation measures
column11: 3D modeling, Environmental impact assessment, Construction, Landscape Architect, Urban planning, Project management, Master planning, Budgeting

column2: Responsibilities:  1.  Client Consultation:  Meet with clients to discuss their needs, preferences, and budget for the landscaping project. Understand their vision, lifestyle, and functional requirements to develop a design that meets their expectations. 2.  Site Analysis:  Conduct site surveys and analysis to assess environmental conditions, soil quality, drainage patterns, existing vegetation, and architectural features. Consider factors such as sun exposure, wind direction, and topography when designing the landscape. 3.  Conceptual Design:  Develop conceptual landscape designs that integrate aesthetic principles with functional elements such as outdoor living spaces, walkways, plantings, water features, and lighting. Present design concepts to clients through sketches, renderings, and digital presentations. 4.  Plant Selection and Layout:  Choose appropriate plants, trees, shrubs, and flowers based on site conditions, climate, soil type, and maintenance requirements. Create planting plans and layouts that enhance the visual appeal and biodiversity of the landscape. 5.  Hardscape Design:  Design hardscape elements such as patios, decks, retaining walls, pathways, and outdoor structures (e.g., pergolas, gazebos). Specify materials, finishes, and construction details that complement the overall design concept and meet client preferences. 6.  Sustainability and Environmental Considerations:  Incorporate sustainable design practices such as rainwater harvesting, native plantings, drought-tolerant landscaping, and eco-friendly materials. Design landscapes that minimize water usage, reduce maintenance needs, and promote biodiversity. 7.  Construction Documentation:  Prepare detailed construction drawings, specifications, and materials lists to communicate design intent to contractors, landscapers, and other stakeholders. Ensure that construction documents comply with local building codes and regulatory requirements. 8.  Project Management:  Coordinate with contractors, subcontractors, and vendors to oversee the implementation of the landscape design. Monitor project progress, resolve issues, and ensure that work is completed according to specifications, budget, and schedule. 9.  Cost Estimation and Budgeting:  Develop cost estimates and budgets for landscaping projects based on design specifications, materials, labor, and other project expenses. Provide clients with accurate cost projections and options to fit their budget constraints. 10.  Planting and Installation:  Supervise the planting and installation of landscape elements, ensuring proper spacing, placement, and installation techniques. Select high-quality plants and materials, and oversee the delivery and handling of landscaping supplies. 11.  Maintenance Planning:  Develop maintenance plans and schedules to ensure the long-term health and vitality of the landscape. Provide clients with guidance on watering, fertilization, pruning, pest control, and seasonal maintenance tasks. 12.  Client Communication and Satisfaction:  Maintain regular communication with clients throughout the design and construction process. Address client feedback, concerns, and revisions promptly to ensure their satisfaction with the final landscape design.
column11: Landscape Design, Creative Designing, Landscaping, Landscape Analysis, Landscape Architecture

column2: Lead Middle East projects with complete design and delivery ownership reporting to Practice Lead.     Take ownership and lead landscape design/pubic realm projects and work packages.     Design manage multi-disciplinary urban development projects.     Liaise with key clients and technical and non-technical stakeholders for positive project outcomes.     Draft technical reports and contractual documents, of acceptable technical and presentation quality with minimum guidance.         Work to a program for the project and proactively advise Senior leadership of any issue which affects the efficient completion of the project.     Ensure the team is aware of the design standards, codes and compliances of countries within the ME region and the same are complied to in the Design.     Check the work of team members and ensure the quality of deliverables meet the Atkins standards of delivery and client expectations.     Demonstrate strategic thinking to expand the landscape urban design business across different regions in the ME.     Is able to contribute to bids and proposals to win work.     Can cross- over through design thinking between the three disciplines of the practice on large scale projects.     Delegate work to assigned project team Graduate (Landscape Architects or urban designers),BIM technicians and Administrative staff.     Use business related software independently with ability to guide work of junior team members.     Successful in identifying and following through on leads/suggestions associated with additional work prospects on the projects they are involved with.     The individual will be required to travel at times to the different Atkins office and sites globally and interface with the team based there.         Qualification         A Master s Degree in Landscape Architecture from universities of International repute is a must.     Bachelor Degree holders in Landscape Architecture or Architecture will be considered, if they can         showcase relevant experience in Landscape Design Project Stages. Including Design, Documentation and site implementation.     CMLI ASLA qualified professionals shall have an added advantage.     Technical Competency     Must have good experience delivering Landscape Design/Public Realm projects in the public or the private realm for minimum 8+ years.     Must be familiar with design, tender and construction processes. International experience specific to ME and beyond will be considered an added advantage.     Must be competent in design, project management, efficiency matrices.     Must be conversant of the evolving standards of the profession primarily with respective to collaborative and multi-disciplinary design.     Must be proficient in AutoCAD, REVIT, Adobe CS5, MS Office, Sketch up and Google Pro. Advanced experience of BIM related software in Landscape Design/Infrastructure works will be considered an added advantage.         Behavioral competency         Excellent communication skills in written and spoken English.     Capable of working on own initiative or as part of a larger multidisciplinary team.     Have a logical and organized approach to project delivery and able to follow instructions and guidance by senior team members.     Be aware of the effect of delivery time on financial performance and proactively manage time, resources and budget on a project.     Able to identify and communicate concerns of the project/team to immediate Line Manager.     Able to discuss career goals and aspirations.     Willingness to share information and knowledge with team members.     Demonstrate initiative and basic leadership skills to give directions to interdisciplinary work group.     Experience of working in virtual teams is a plus.

column2: Role & responsibilities     1) Responsible for the overall Design management of Landscape (Hardscape & Softscape) development and coordination from the Conception stage till the Handover of the projects.  2) To be responsible for coordination of landscape design and working drawings (softscape & hardscape) for concepts, schematic elevations showing materials, tile sizes, typical paving details, typical sections, patterns, finishes, presentation, analyze designs of landscape consultants etc. as required and for procuring required approvals from Government bodies & to facilitate smooth landscape execution. 3) To coordinate for MOEF drawings for layout, Municipal drawings, NOCs and LEED documents for Green building certification. 4) To coordinate / create design work based on construction schedule. 5) To be responsible to appoint various consultants like Landscape Architects and other specialist consultants, as may be required. 6) To prepare details in form of drawings and reference images. 7) To be involved in selection of materials both hardscape & softscape, equipments and bought out items in conjunction with internal process / norms. 8) To select plants / trees / shrubs adapting to the project design & location 9) To coordinate / assist in design execution of landscaping for interior projects as required 10) To ensure Value Engineering of design quality, superior workmanship and proper execution at each stage to fit the project within budget.  11) To be responsible for the finalization of requirements & specifications in consultation with internal & external teams as well as project scheduling including material & manpower for landscape & horticulture. 12) To keep a check on landscaping activities & ensure completion of project within the time & cost parameter and effective resource utilization to maximize the output. 13) To participate in project review meetings for tracking progress & troubleshooting & implementation of procedures as per norms and standards for landscaping. 14) To liaise with external agencies, architects and consultants for determining technical specifications, approval for execution and obtaining on-time clearances for landscaping. 15) To maintain all landscaping for our current project on regular basis. Preferred candidate profile   Candidate with good communication skills and organized in terms of coordination and design management Prefer candidates with Project Management experience

column2: JOB DESCRIPTION DESIGNATION : Executive/ Assistant Manager (Landscape) DEPARTMENT NAME : Design Strategy LOCATION : HO REPORTING TO : Deputy General Manager (Landscape) JOB DESCRIPTION: The incumbent is responsible for supporting the Landscape team in the Design Strategy function at HO in line with the companys vision for a sustainable corporate growth and success. Includes working on ongoing initiatives, creating awareness of the initiatives through workshops and research on future trends of design, material & technology for relevant adoption within GPL system. Prime responsibility will include: - Working on strategic initiatives & their implementation. - Research (Local & International Markets) on upcoming industry trends. - Design detailing & guidelines wrt landscape and architecture. - Curating cross learning & development within the function ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Responsibility Area Key Activities Indicative Performance Measures 1. Design & Product  Design review/ comments/ coordination/ presentations/ marketing collaterals/ product decks/ USP finalization.  Create details wrt landscape architecture.  Curate implementation of initiatives through creative, GIFs, animations.  Implement quality assurance measures to ensure that landscape designs meet GPL standards, and project requirements. Review, comment report and timely delivery of design/ details/ creatives Technology- Pilot & adoption 2. Technology  Supporting with setting up any technological intervention within our system including workflows and implementation across zones. Review, comment report and timely delivery of design/ details/ creatives Research on upcoming industry trends 3. Local/ International Market Monitor  Market/ Competition Mapping  Customer Profiling  Projections & Predictions  External/ Internal Influential Factors  Recommendation Review and report Responsibility Area Key Activities Indicative Performance Measures 4. Process Monitor  Coordinate and manage the design process for outdoor spaces, including parks, gardens, streetscapes, and recreational areas within residential developments. This involves overseeing multiple projects simultaneously, from conceptualization to completion, ensuring they align with the developer's vision and objectives.  Conduct regular site inspections and reviews to monitor progress, identify issues, and implement corrective actions as needed.  Assessment & understanding of internal processes.  Mapping of competition/ industry best practice (processes) and implementation of the same in GPL. Review, comment report and timely delivery of design/ details/ creatives People Management and Development 5. Learning and Development  Coordinate with external vendors, contractors, and suppliers to procure materials, equipment, and services required for landscape construction.  Monitor project expenditures throughout the design process to ensure adherence to budgetary constraints.  Stay informed about current trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in landscape architecture through ongoing education, training, and participation in professional organizations. Review, comment report and timely delivery of design/ details/ creatives KEY INTERACTIONS: Internal External Design, Strategy, Operations & other functions Relevant consultants/ partners at head office/ zonal/ regional offices. Position Specifications (Know-How, Skills, and Knowledge for this position): Threshold Education/ Qualification & Experience Applicants should be graduates or (postgraduates): B. Arch with 2-3 years of relevant industry experience in landscape architecture or M. Arch freshers. Unique expertise by way of acknowledgements in the past would be appreciated e.g., Project management skills, photography skills, presentation skills, technological expertise etc. Software skills Design software CAD/ Revit/ Sketch up/ ArchiCAD/ other relevant software MS Office MS Word/ Excel/ PowerPoint/ other relevant software Others Rhino/ Grasshopper/ Dynamo (optional) Godrej Capability Factors Leading Self  Initiative: Drive Ownership and find way through ambiguity  Hunger to Learn & Improve: Humility, Growth Mind-set, Committed to Change  Emotional & Social Awareness: Maturity, Self-Awareness, Influence Leading Others  Fostering Collaboration: Godrej First, collaborates, Builds Bridges Leading Business  Customer Centricity: Insightful, Innovates, Delights  Delivering Results: Commercial Acumen, Execution Excellence, Agility  Institution Building: Role Model, Knowledge Sharing, Shape Culture

column2: Landscape architects design outdoor spaces, considering aesthetic, functional, and environmental factors. They conduct site analysis, collaborate with clients, and manage projects from conception to completion. Sustainability is integral, employing eco-friendly practices like native plant use and water conservation. Through graphic presentations, they communicate design ideas to clients and stakeholders. During construction, they oversee implementation, ensuring adherence to specifications. They also plan for ongoing maintenance to preserve the landscape's health and attractiveness. Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
column11: Design, Sketchup, AutoCAD

column2: We are looking for a Senior or Associate level Landscape Architect with 10+ years of experience to lead the next stage of growth of the BDP Landscape Architecture team in Delhi. The successful candidate will be expected to win work and build a portfolio of domestic and international projects to be delivered by growing the existing landscape architecture team to design and execute the work.      The candidate must have a passion for design and excellent presentation and work- winning skills, including drafting proposals, preparing pitches and demonstrable design skills including sketching and detailed design, and be a competent user of recognised industry software.      Experience in a leadership position and a proven track record of independently managing clients and delivering projects will be required for the role. A combination of local and international work experience will be considered an asset.      We are looking for someone who can inspire, mentor and encourage junior Landscape Architects within the team to assist them with their professional development and growth at BDP. The successful candidate will be able to supervise technical staff through the design development and execution stages to ensure minimum deviation from the integrity of the design concepts whilst delivering a profitable performance.      The right candidate will join the BDP India leadership team, contributing to the strategic development of the business.      Our studio established in 2010, comprises architects, urban designers/planners and landscape architects. The business has rapidly grown to encompass a wide variety of multi and mono disciplinary commissions. Based in New Delhi, it has a Pan India clientele while also servicing the Landscape Architecture requirements of our studios in the Middle East, South Asia and China and collaborating with BDP s Landscape Architecture teams in the UK.      The studio has delivered a number of prestigious Higher Education Campuses and residential townships. Being a part of a multi-disciplinary environment, the landscape profession contributes in a substantial manner to our allied Master planning, Urban Design and Architecture disciplines. Current projects range from a variety of commercial and retail developments to Urban Development guidelines and feasibility studies.      BDP offers an environment which encourages creativity, team work and continued growth as a professional. The right candidate can expect a competitive remuneration and benefits package combined with a positive working environment and a healthy attitude to work-life balance.

Excellent communication and teamwork skills      Eagerness to learn and contribute to projects      Ability to adapt to fast-paced environments and take direction from senior team members.

column2: Role & responsibilities   1. To be Responsible for the overall management of Landscape (Hardscape & Softscape) development from the Conception stage till the Execution & Handover of all Residential & Commercial projects. Design Management a) To be responsible for landscape design and working drawings (softscape & hardscape) for concepts, schematic elevations showing materials, tile sizes, typical paving details, typical sections, patterns, finishes, presentation, analyze designs of landscape consultants etc as required and for procuring required approvals from Government bodies & to facilitate smooth landscape execution b) To prepare MOEF drawings for tree layout, BMC drawings for Tree NOCs and LEED documents for Green building certification. c) To plan / create design work based on construction schedule , customer needs as required d) To be responsible to appoint various consultants like Landscape Architects and other specialist consultants, as may be required e) To prepare details for outdoor lighting, fountains, wall murals, feature walls, pergolas, sculptures, play equipments in form of drawings and reference images. f) To be involved in selection of materials both hardscape & softscape, electrical fixtures, play equipments and bought out items in conjunction with internal process / norms. g) To select plants / trees / shrubs adapting to the project design & location a) To assist in design execution of landscaping for interior projects as required h) To ensure Value Engineering of design quality, superior workmanship and proper execution at each stage to fit the project within budget. Project Planning  a) To be responsible for the finalization of requirements & specifications in consultation with internal & external teams as well as project scheduling including material & manpower for landscape & horticulture. b) To anchor on-site landscaping activities & ensure completion of project within the time & cost parameter and effective resource utilization to maximize the output. c) To participate in project review meetings for tracking progress & troubleshooting & implementation of QA/QC procedures as per norms and standards for landscaping d) To liaise with external agencies, clients, architects and consultants for determining technical specifications, approval for execution and obtaining on-time clearances for landscaping.  To maintain all landscaping for our current project and show flats on regular basis.  Preferred candidate profile   B. Arch / M. Arch With 08 -12 years of Landscape Designing & Execution for multifaceted experience in specialized area of Designing / Design coordination of Residential, IT Parks, Retail, Malls
column11: Landscape Design, Landscape Architecture, Urban Planning, Horticulture, Landscaping, Gardening, Urban Design, Floriculture

column2: Skills and Qualification Required:       Manage the BIM projects and entire BIM team for better execution of projects     Project planning and resource allocation     Identify scope of work, review client inputs and estimate new BIM projects      Use and identify tools that automate or make tasks easier for BIM projects     Client communication, participation in technical calls or marketing calls     Assist in recruiting BIM Architects, Engineers etc.      Quality checking and monitoring productivity of Team Leaders     Identifying potential issues and provide resolutions to team members/clients     Planning and implementing training programs for juniors or experienced staff     One on one meetings with Production team members in a timely manner     Constant Research on New skills and versions of Revit and other BIM tools         Qualifications:    B-Arch/M-Arch         Experience:    5 to 7 years of working on International BIM projects       Other skills       Excellent communication skills     Experience of leading a BIM team will be preferred     AutoCAD, Sketch up, Revit, Navisworks experience mandatory     Knowledge of Dynamo scripting and API will be added advantage
